content:
@Yunwei Wang and I are planning to host the US Core Jan 2021 track orientation next Friday 12/11 from 12-1 PM Eastern!

Topic: USCore Track Orientation
Time: Dec 11, 2020 11:00 AM Central Time (US and Canada)

Join ZoomGov Meeting
https://mitre.zoomgov.com/j/1616679036?pwd=VHdhb21RZUNEL21Ndm9FcEJsZGpwdz09

We are debating a bit about how to focus on upcoming US FHIR Core 3.2.0 and are open to your ideas!
Argonaut US Core Connectathon Overview presentation. Please join to let us know if you have specific pieces of the IG you want us to test!

Hi Argonauts! We're not formally participating in this track this cycle, but wanted to share the location of a few Epic FHIR servers, in case they're helpful to others.

  • https://fhir.epic.com/interconnect-fhir-oauth/api/FHIR/R4/metadata
    This FHIR server is generally available all the time, even outside of connectathons. You need to create a developer account and a client id to access it. There's some really great documentation and information on this site.

  • https://apporchard.epic.com/interconnect-aocurprd-oauth/api/FHIR/R4
    Of course, if you're already enrolled in the App Orchard developer program, you've likely already created a client id. This is a great way to test R4.

  • https://connectathon.epic.com/Interconnect-Fhir-Unsecure/api/FHIR/R4/metadata
    Lastly, we're temporarily turning on a temporary and less stable FHIR server, that may be unavailable as we hack away during the connectathon.
Is there a zoom link for the track?
Visit Whova Home page Agenda page tp retrieve links for all the sessions
thanks, forgot about whova :sweat_smile:

@Madhur Rajendran I have partially run Inferno test on cerner server using my own copy of inferno. The lagging we have seen is due to Inferno sent big number of validation requests which slowed down validation service.
